entry.summary: Space is big and scary, and a new video created from Webb Space Telescope data goes to show the massive distances separating us from the objects we‚Äôre trying to observe. In this case, it‚Äôs the¬†Cartwheel Galaxy, one of Webb‚Äôs recent targets. Read more...

entry.title: Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power Director Talks Expectations and Blending Genres
entry.summary: In a few short weeks, Amazon becomes Middle Earth. The trillion-dollar company has invested hundreds of millions of dollars in bringing the latest iteration of J.R.R. Tolkien‚Äôs Lord of the Rings franchise to its streaming service. That show, The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power, debuts September 2, and few‚Ä¶ Read more...

entry.title: Filled with Light, An A-Frame House Designed by Naturvillan Functions Entirely Off the Grid
entry.summary: Mimicking the peaks of the surrounding conifers, an A-frame house in Sikhall, V√§nersborg, Sweden is designed for entirely self-sufficient living. The largely wood and glass construction is the project of Naturvillan, a Swedish architecture firm focusing on building homes with minimal impacts on the environment. The triangular model shown here is ‚ÄúAtri,‚Äù a light-filled house with a wood-burning stove and solar panels attached to its slanted roof. Intended for energy production in both winter and summer, the two sources are robust enough to heat the water and provide electricity. More

entry.title: RISD Continuing Education Opens Fall Registration With 10 Online Certificates
entry.summary: Choose from more than 140 courses for adults and youth ages 13 to 17 this fall at Rhode Island School of Design Continuing Education, including options for beginning, intermediate, and advanced students. Enroll by August 23 to save 10% with the code EARLYBIRDCE. This fall, RISD CE online courses offer adult students a range of courses for all skill levels that can be taken at any time of day or night, from anywhere in the world. More

entry.title: Discarded Tools, Scrap Metals, and Fabrics Form the Spirited Sculptures by Mohsen Heydari Yeganeh
entry.summary: Artist Mohsen Heydari Yeganeh extends the life of broken tools, wooden handles, and scraps of fabric found in resale shops, stalls, and alleys. Utilizing chains for plumage or a long, steel blade for a beak, Yeganeh forms stylized animalistic assemblages of discarded materials, which he refers to as ‚Äúflying garbages.‚Äù Conveying the awkward, jutting postures of birds or the broad stance of a bison, the spirited sculptures combine abstract components into lively, expressive characters. More

entry.title: Underwater Photos by Steven Kovacs Frame the Shimmering Unearthly Bodies of Larval Fish
entry.summary: Set against the stark backdrops attainable only during blackwater dives, larval fish become strange, otherworldly specimens with glasslike bodies and translucent fins that billow outward. Their delicate, still-developing anatomies are the subjects of Steven Kovacs‚Äôs underwater photos, which frame the young creatures at such precarious stages of life. Living in Palm Beach, Kovacs (previously) frequents the waters off the Florida coasts, although he‚Äôs also recently explored areas near Kona, Hawaii. More

entry.title: In Graham Franciose‚Äôs ‚ÄòMorning Coffee Paintings,‚Äô Dreamlike Watercolor Works Capture the Day‚Äôs Unmediated Emotion
entry.summary: Many days, artist and illustrator Graham Franciose sits down with watercolor, gouache, and a small sheet of cotton paper to paint a whimsical scene or surreal moment. A skateboarder carries a tree in a backpack, an anxious figure peeks through a colorful monster mask, and an oversized lion snarls at an approaching man. ‚ÄúI like to do these first thing in the morning when I am still not fully awake and start with a blank slate and no preconceived idea,‚Äù he tells Colossal. More

entry.title: A Surprising Photo Captures an Osprey Gently Gliding Along the Water‚Äôs Surface
entry.summary: Ospreys, the large raptors with barbed talons and dense, oily plumage, feed almost exclusively on fish and are known to completely submerge themselves in the water during a hunt. An unanticipated photo by Andy Woo, though, captures the avian predator in a botched attempt as it skims the surface rather than plunging in to retrieve its next meal. ‚ÄúAlthough I couldn‚Äôt figure out what just happened at the time, in looking at the sequence I captured, it looks to me like the osprey tried to grab a fish out of the water, missed, and then could not get enough lift to quickly get back in the air,‚Äù he tells Peta Pixel. More

entry.title: In a Patterned Menagerie, Artist Anne Lemanski Stitches Printed Papers into Animal Forms
entry.summary: Constellations, butterflies, and bold checkered prints overlay the animalistic forms by Anne Lemanski. Beginning with a copper armature, the North Carolina-based artist stretches vintage paper or patterns of scanned objects across a minimal metal form and stitches the edges together into a geometric patchwork. Ranging from abstract shapes to illustrations and photos, the printed motifs evoke each character‚Äôs temperament, presence, and overall essence. ‚ÄúStella Terra,‚Äù for example, is sheathed in white paper, and images of animals and objects speckle the ephemeral material similar to the spotted coat of the live Appaloosa counterpart. More

entry.title: A Playfully Grotesque Monster Peeks Out of Dana√©¬†Brissonnet‚Äôs Ravenous Mural in Montr√©al
entry.summary: A grotesquely beautiful monster with monarch wings, long feathered lashes, and a curiously large mouth has taken over a corner building in Montr√©al. The cheeky puppet mural is by French-Canadian artist Dana√©¬†Brissonnet in collaboration with Poncili Creacion and stands at the intersection of Boulevard Saint Laurent and Rue Marie Anne. Centered around the theme of digestion, the massive public work is a playful, metaphorical interpretation of the bodily process. ‚ÄúThese days I‚Äôm intrigued with exploring the ways in which I nourish myself‚Ä¶ the who and what I let inside,‚Äù Brissonnet writes on Instagram. More
